intro: Rourea orientalis var. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar rourea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
